intro: Geranium santanderiense, commonly known as the Santander geranium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant pink or purple blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Geranium santanderiense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats.
